alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:07PM CDT until May 18 at 5:48PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. Roseau River at Roseau affecting Roseau County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Pembina River at Neche affecting Pembina County. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Sheyenne River at Valley City affecting Barnes County. Sheyenne River at Lisbon affecting Ransom County. Maple River near Enderlin affecting Ransom and Cass Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River below Warren. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 71.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 71.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM CDT Saturday was 71.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning and continue falling to 64.1 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 67.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
